Africa.name: Kenya
Africa.Description: Indian Ocean Commission award “Assessing the multisectorial context for biodiversity conservation in and sharing lessons among Tanzania and Kenya using the Ocean Health Index organizing framework and decision-making tool”.

Africa.name: Tanzania
Africa.Description: Indian Ocean Commission award “Assessing the multisectorial context for biodiversity conservation in and sharing lessons among Tanzania and Kenya using the Ocean Health Index organizing framework and decision-making tool”.

Arctic.name: Arctic
Arctic.Description: Academic assessment conducted as part of a PhD dissertation.

North America.name: Canada
North America.Description: A pilot study to better represent Canada at the national level by incorporating public goals and goal weightings that are more relevant to Canadians.

North America.name: Canada-Atlantic
North America.LeadingGroup: Institut des Sciences de la Mer de Rimouski, Université du Québec à Rimouski
North America.Description: An OHI+ assessment for Atlantic Canada’s marine biogeographic regions with a focus on the Saint Lawrence gulf/estuary.

North America.name: Canada-British Columbia
North America.LeadingGroup: National Center for Ecological Analysis and Synthesis at UC Santa Barbara
North America.Description: Working with local partners, this assessment will incorporate locally meaningful information, priorities, and perspectives to track change in the health of B.C.’s ocean during the past ten years and to describe how management may have contributed to these patterns.

North America.name: Mexico
North America.LeadingGroup: Mexico’s Department of the Environment and Natural Resources (SEMARNAT)
North America.Description: Working with local partners, this assessment will incorporate locally meaningful information, priorities, and perspectives to track change in the health of B.C.’s ocean during the past ten years and to describe how management may have contributed to these patterns.

North America.name: US-Northeast
North America.LeadingGroup: National Center for Ecological Analysis and Synthesis at UC Santa Barbara
North America.Description: The OHI is being used as a tool for monitoring and evaluation in the US Northeast Ocean Plan, finalized by the National Ocean Council on December 7, 2016. Working with local partners, we will adapt the Index to capture priorities for ocean health in the Northeast. Our approach will incorporate locally meaningful information and perspectives in order to track change in the health of the ocean. The OHI will also be applied over the past ten years to examine changes in regional ocean health to better understand how management may have contributed to these patterns.

North America.name: US-West-Coast
North America.LeadingGroup: National Center for Ecological Analysis and Synthesis at UC Santa Barbara and Conservation International
North America.Description: Test of the OHI framework for five coastal sub-regions, using ~80% local data and modified goal models.

Oceania.name: Fiji
Oceania.LeadingGroup: National Center for Ecological Analysis and Synthesis at UC Santa Barbara and Conservation International
Oceania.Description: Test of the OHI framework at the national scale, using available local data for five goals.

Oceania.name: New Caledonia
Oceania.LeadingGroup: Conservation International, Department of Marine Affairs
Oceania.Description: Following the Proof of Concept assessment completed in 2016, the project focuses on establishing a baseline for the management of the Coral Sea Park to allow for ongoing monitoring, assessing, and adaptive management.

Oceania.name: Palmyra
Oceania.LeadingGroup: The Nature Conservancy’s Palmyra 4site team and NCEAS
Oceania.Description: To assess the performance of 7 goals on Palmyra, a mostly uninhabited island in the Line Islands Archipelago halfway between Hawaii and American Samoa that is a National Wildlife Refuge administered by the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service and was purchased by The Nature Conservancy in 2000.

Oceania.name: Samoa
Oceania.LeadingGroup: Conservation International, Division of Environmental Conservation
Oceania.Description: National level assessment to measure progress towards ocean health and sustainable economic growth.

Oceania.name: Tetiaroa
Oceania.LeadingGroup: Tetiaroa Society’s Tetiaroa 4site team and NCEAS
Oceania.Description: To assess the performance of 5 goals on Tetiaroa, a mostly uninhabited collection of islets in the Windward group of the Society Islands of French Polynesia where management, conservation, and protection of the entire island are carried out by the Tetiaroa Society, a US-based non-profit organization.

Oceania.name: US-Hawaii
Oceania.LeadingGroup: Conservation International and the U.S. National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration
Oceania.Description: The Hawaii Ocean Health Index is integrating economic, social, and ecological information to track the sustainable use of our ocean resources. This assessment will increase awareness on the activities that are being done across the state that support the sustainable use of our ocean resources and identify remaining knowledge gaps and priorities. With this information we we will catalyze stakeholder involvement across sectors and facilitate collaborations to ensure the health of our ocean now and into the future.

South America.name: Brazil
South America.LeadingGroup: National Center for Ecological Analysis and Synthesis at UC Santa Barbara and Conservation International
South America.Description: Test of the OHI framework for Brazil’s 17 coastal states, using ~50% local data and modified models for five goals.

South America.name: Chile
South America.LeadingGroup: Centro de Investigación en Ecosistemas Marinos de Altas Latitudes; Instituto Milenio en Socio-Ecología Costera
South America.Contact: Laura Nahuelhual Muñoz (laura.nahuel@gmail.com), Universidad de Los Lagos; Vanessa Pizarro (va.pizarropizarro@gmail.com)

South America.name: Colombia
South America.Description: National assessment of Colombia’s Pacific, Atlantic, and Caribbean Islands regions developed with 113 national indicators and through a multi-agency working group.

South America.name: Ecuador-Gulf-Of-Guayaquil
South America.Description: Completed assessment of the Gulf of Guayaquil (Provinces of El Oro, Guayas, Santa Elena) using 96 local indicators, 4 context specific models, and 5 locally relevant reference points..

Europe.name: Baltic Sea
Europe.Description: Transboundary assessment of the Baltic Sea at jurisdiction and basin scales. Nine goals are being assessed.

Europe.name: Norway
Europe.Description: Study exploring human-ecological interactions in 81 municipalities in northern Norway.

Europe.name: Spain-Bay Of Biscay
Europe.Description: This group will compare OHI process and scores with findings of other existing methodologies for assessing ocean health.

Europe.name: Spain-Gulf Of Cadiz
Europe.Description: This assessment will evaluate the Gulf of Cadiz and compare its health through time.

Europe.name: Spain-Ria De Vigo
Europe.Description: This assessment will evaluate the coast of Galicia and compare its health through time.

Europe.name: United-Kingdom Cornwall
Europe.Description: In English waters Marine Spatial Planning (MSP) is currently being implemented by the UK Marine Management Organisation (MMO) through a set of regional Marine Plans. The South West Marine Plan (SWMP) offers a regional approach for MSP in busy maritime areas such as the Western Approaches, English Channel and Celtic Sea.

Asia.name: China
Asia.Description: National assessment of China’s 11 coastal provinces using locally developed models, reference points, and data.

Asia.name: China - Xiamen
Asia.LeadingGroup: Fujian Provincial Key Laboratory for Coastal Ecology and Environmental Studies, Coastal and Ocean Management Institute, Xiamen University
Asia.Contact: Deqiang Ma (dqma@xmu.edu.cn), Qinhua Fang (qhfang@xmu.edu.cn), Shuhao Liao (362453823@qq.com)
Asia.Description: Applying the Ocean Health Index framework to the city level: A case study of Xiamen, China

Asia.name: China - Shanghai
Asia.LeadingGroup: School of Geographic and Oceanographic Sciences, Nanjing University
Asia.Description: Application of the Ocean Health Index to assess ecosystem health for the coastal areas of Shanghai, China

Asia.name: Indonesia-Bali
Asia.LeadingGroup: Ministry of Marine Affairs and Fisheries, Conservation International
Asia.Description: Pilot assessment for the provincial island of Bali to fine tune the OHI framework to the Indonesian context and build local capacity.

Asia.name: Indonesia-Tuban
Asia.Description: Measurement of Indonesian Marine Health Index to Assess The Health of The Coastal Ecosystem of Tuban, East Java.

Asia.name: Israel
Asia.LeadingGroup: Hamaraag — Israel’s National Nature Assessment Program
Asia.Description: First indepently-led assessment, evaluated 6 regions of Israel’s Mediterranean coast.

Asia.name: South Korea
Asia.Description: Nationwide project to assess the health of oceans in South Korea. Efforts will focus on running management scenarios to test implications of proposed projects.
